model.interfaces

Interface IModel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Model

    public interface IModel
extends java.io.Serializable
    Interface that defines the complete annual timetable and manage the list of every course of the faculty of informatics science and technology in Cesena. It represents the Model in the architectural pattern MVC.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IModel.IMemento
      * Interface that defines memento, namely an object that contains the state in which the structure is in a specified moment.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FIRST_SEM
      Constant to specify the first semester.
      static int SEC_SEM
      Constant to specify the second semester.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(ISubject sub,
         int sem,
         Days d,
         Classrooms room,
         int hour,
         int n)
        It adds a subject in the timetable in a classroom in the selected hour, in a specified day of the specified semester.
        Parameters:
        sub - Course to be added in the timetable.
        sem - Semester in which the course has to be added.
        d - Day in which the course has to be added.
        room - Classroom in which the course has to be added.
        hour - Course starting time.
        n - Number of consecutive hours in which the course has to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sem does not correspond to FIRST_SEM nor to SEC_SEM or in the cases that are specified in the method IWeeklyTime.add(ISubject, Days, Classrooms, int, int).

      • remove

        void remove(int sem,
            Days d,
            Classrooms room,
            int hour,
            int n)
        It removes every course in the timetable of a classroom in the specified hours of a specified day in the specified semester.
        Parameters:
        sem - Semester in which the course has to be deleted.
        d - Day in which the course has to be deleted.
        room - Classroom in which the course has to be deleted.
        hour - Hour from which starting to deleting.
        n - Number of consecutive hours to be deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sem does not correspond to FIRST_SEM nor to SEC_SEM or in the cases that are specified in the method IWeeklyTime.remove(Days, Classrooms, int, int).

      • addSubject

        void addSubject(java.lang.String sub,
                java.lang.String teach,
                SubjectType type)
        It creates a new course and it adds this to the list of available courses, in the case in which this course is already on the list it does not add anything.
        Parameters:
        sub - Name of the course.
        teach - Name of the teacher.
        type - Type of course.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters is null.

      • removeSubject

        void removeSubject(ISubject sub)
        It removes a course from the list of available courses, in the case of lack of the course passed as a parameter it does not occur anything.
        Parameters:
        sub - Course to be deleted from the list.

      • getSubject

        java.util.Optional<ISubject> getSubject(int sem,
                                        Days d,
                                        Classrooms room,
                                        int hour)
        It gives back the course given in a classroom in a specified day in a specified hour of the chosen semester.
        Parameters:
        sem - Semester in which it is necessary to look for the course to be given back.
        d - Day in which it is necessary to look for the course to be given back.
        room - Classroom in which it is necessary to look for the course to be given back.
        hour - Hour in which it is necessary to look for the course to be given back.
        Returns:
        The course given in the specified classroom, in the specified day and in specified semester. It is used an Optional in order to avoid giving back null Optional in case there is no course in the selected hour.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sem does not correspond to FIRST_SEM nor to SEC_SEM or in the cases that are specified in the method IWeeklyTime.getSubject(Days, Classrooms, int).

      • getSubjects

        java.util.Set<ISubject> getSubjects()
        It gives back a copy of the list of available courses.
        Returns:
        Set containing all courses.

      • setSubjects

        void setSubjects(java.util.Set<ISubject> set)
        It allows to import the list of available courses.
        Parameters:
        set - Set containing the new list of courses.

      • whereTeaching

        java.util.Set<Classrooms> whereTeaching(java.lang.String teach,
                                        int sem,
                                        Days d,
                                        int hour)
        It gives back a set containing in what classrooms is the specified teacher in a specified hour of the given day in the chosen semester.
        Parameters:
        teach - Name of the teacher who has the lesson of which we want to know where and at what time.
        sem - Semester in which looking on.
        d - Day in which looking on.
        hour - Hour in which looking on between different classrooms.
        Returns:
        Set containing classrooms or empty set in the case that the course is not in the specified hour or if teach is null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sem does not correspond to FIRST_SEM nor to SEC_SEM or in the cases that are specified in the method IWeeklyTime.whereTeaching(String, Days, int).

      • wherePerforming

        java.util.Set<Classrooms> wherePerforming(ISubject sub,
                                          int sem,
                                          Days d,
                                          int hour)
        It gives back a set containing in what classrooms is a course in a specified hour of the day and in the semester chosen.
        Parameters:
        sub - Course of which we want to know where it is in a specified hour.
        sem - Semester in which looking for.
        d - Day in which looking for.
        hour - Hour in which looking for between different classroom.
        Returns:
        Set containing classrooms or empty set in the case that the course is not in the specified hour or if teach is null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sem does not correspond to FIRST_SEM nor to SEC_SEM or in the cases that are specified in the method IWeeklyTime.wherePerforming(ISubject, Days, int).

      • getTeachers

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getTeachers()
        It gives back a set with all teachers’ names.
        Returns:
        Set with teachers’ names.

      • createMemento

        IModel.IMemento createMemento()
        Method to create a memento, namely to create an object I n which is described the current state of the structure.
        Returns:
        the Memento object.

      • setMemento

        void setMemento(IModel.IMemento mem)
        Method to set the model according to a previous state depending on what mem contains.
        Parameters:
        mem - Previous state to which we want to set the model.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if mem or IModel.IMemento.getState() are null.
